title: Mod Abuse is Out of Control
body:
Hear me out. 

My premise is that the boards/mods in general are overly sensitive, and prone to censor anyone that is even remotely critical (or as they so loosely define as "toxic"). So over time anyone not conforming to their G-rated boards get banned/censored and move to reddit, where the process repeats. You are welcome to disagree, **the problem is other people aren't because they will get censored because I am right**.

I would also argue that given this state, the only people bothering to post are either so sensitive they like the censorship, or the typical aspiring mods posting the usual boring, corporate, lawyer speak and linking the summoners code in every post. (yawn)

So its 2019 and anyone wasting time on the boards is likely in those categories.

I was recently suspended for referring to the Chinese Communist Party as "Chi-Com" for short. A moderator said that was a racial slur and I was guilty of "racial hatred". I'm not sure if the mods are that clueless, or if they are SJWs drooling for a chance to claim someone is a victim, but this is just stupid. 

Can we please get some accountability on the forum censorship. I'm sure this thread will be downvoted by the overly-sensitive low-T posters that remain here, but if I haven't made it clear enough... I don't care about your downvotes, because I have seen what you upvote.

REST IN PEACE, RIOT FORUMS.

replies.body:
Hey,

Can you access your removal messages? You were banned on the 8th for making a political/social post about Tianamen square. It was your 8 removals in 10 days, and given your history, a 3 day suspension was applied to your account. My name is at the bottom of the removal message.

Edit. 
~~Feel free to inquire about your other removals here, as I will he removing your other post, mostly due to it being blatantly inaccurate. ~~

Edit2: I’ve looked into your other discussion about another mods’ removal, and I’ll get back to you about that when I can. 

Last edit: so it seems Cali was explaining to you that you were using a disparaging term, chicoms. This was present in the political social post, but your history of recent removals and history of prior suspensions warranted a 3 day suspension.

> [{quoted}](name=Periscope,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-12-13T08:11:41.567+0000)
>
> Hey,
> 
> Can you access your removal messages? You were banned on the 8th for making a political/social post about Tianamen square. It was your 8 removals in 10 days, and given your history, a 3 day suspension was applied to your account. My name is at the bottom of the removal message.
> 
> Edit. 
> ~~Feel free to inquire about your other removals here, as I will he removing your other post, mostly due to it being blatantly inaccurate. ~~
> 
> Edit2: I’ve looked into your other discussion about another mods’ removal, and I’ll get back to you about that when I can. 
> 
> Last edit: so it seems Cali was explaining to you that you were using a disparaging term, chicoms. This was present in the political social post, but your history of recent removals and history of prior suspensions warranted a 3 day suspension.

This term I didn't even know and after googeling it apparently means "chinese communist" can get you banned for 3 days and your content deleted? WTF???
You are crazy.
Just remove the term and maybe talk to people if you think it's such an issue. You act like a crazy dictators.
Truth be told, I didn’t know the term until today. The ban came because of the number of removals in a short period: 8 in ten days.

I am the moderator who referred to your use of "chicom" as a racial slur.    If it isn't a racial slur, it's a *highly* politicized and unfriendly term for the Communist Chinese.  I'm sorry you feel you've had a poor experience with my moderation, but it's not okay either way.  

I'm happy to have the conversation with you about whether or not this is abuse.  You always have the right to ask for review on your cases.  [ Indeed you can come to our Discord and ask for me to be fired if the spirit moves you](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/7rtKBZLi-boards-moderation-discord-verification);  but I guarantee you "chicom" is not acceptable either way - if it isn't classified as a racial slur it's going to be classified under Inappropriate Discussion Topics as it refers to real-world politics.

Real-world political discussions are barred on these Boards, not because we want our users to be apolitical, but because it's *not the right venue for real-world political discussion*.  Such political threads devolve into terrible flame wars with regularity here and spark dozens of reports, making our job near-impossible - it is the current position of the modteam that they are a distraction from the discussion of League and Runeterra at best, dangerous and likely to incite hatred at worst. 

There are plenty of places you can vent your frustrations with Chinese politics on the Internet.  This isn't one of them, and you also *cannot* just go blaming China for everything you find wrong with League these days.   It seems to be very popular to blame Tencent because League isn't like old League - but the truth is that Tencent has been involved with League since Season 1 or before, as best I understand the real history of this game.  

We're always willing to have the discussion with you, if you're going to have the discussion in respect.  We're always willing to do better as Moderators as well.  I'm sorry you feel you've had a poor experience, but this "wear downvotes like a badge of honor" attitude is not going to serve you well.  

[Being part of the community here means trying your best to be a part of the community in kindness and respect.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE)

> [{quoted}](name=CaliCoastReplay,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-12-13T09:33:32.262+0000)
>
> I am the moderator who referred to your use of "chicom" as a racial slur.    If it isn't a racial slur, it's a *highly* politicized and unfriendly term for the Communist Chinese.  I'm sorry you feel you've had a poor experience with my moderation, but it's not okay either way.  
> 
> I'm happy to have the conversation with you about whether or not this is abuse.  You always have the right to ask for review on your cases.  [ Indeed you can come to our Discord and ask for me to be fired if the spirit moves you](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/7rtKBZLi-boards-moderation-discord-verification);  but I guarantee you "chicom" is not acceptable either way - if it isn't classified as a racial slur it's going to be classified under Inappropriate Discussion Topics as it refers to real-world politics.
> 
> Real-world political discussions are barred on these Boards, not because we want our users to be apolitical, but because it's *not the right venue for real-world political discussion*.  Such political threads devolve into terrible flame wars with regularity here and spark dozens of reports, making our job near-impossible - it is the current position of the modteam that they are a distraction from the discussion of League and Runeterra at best, dangerous and likely to incite hatred at worst. 
> 
> There are plenty of places you can vent your frustrations with Chinese politics on the Internet.  This isn't one of them, and you also *cannot* just go blaming China for everything you find wrong with League these days.   It seems to be very popular to blame Tencent because League isn't like old League - but the truth is that Tencent has been involved with League since Season 1 or before, as best I understand the real history of this game.  
> 
> We're always willing to have the discussion with you, if you're going to have the discussion in respect.  We're always willing to do better as Moderators as well.  I'm sorry you feel you've had a poor experience, but this "wear downvotes like a badge of honor" attitude is not going to serve you well.  
> 
> [Being part of the community here means trying your best to be a part of the community in kindness and respect.](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE)

Kindess and respect...
Such as deleting peoples content and banning them for 3 days because you THINK that something MIGHT be offensive to SOME people.
So kind... so respectful... wow....

> [{quoted}](name=Salty Mc Feed,realm=EUW,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-12-13T12:52:08.920+0000)
>
> Kindess and respect...
> Such as deleting peoples content and banning them for 3 days because you THINK that something MIGHT be offensive to SOME people.
> So kind... so respectful... wow....

Dude, that's not a random applied ban. To be honest I am even quite surprised that they got only “a slap on the wrist“ for breaking the rules on a daily basis for so long. 

I don't wanna spread misinformation but as far as I remember they even had a removal of one thread/comment or even more because of racism (?)

Edit: I copypasted a part of one explanation OP already received in another thread.

> Maybe learn the actual history of the word you're using - "chicom" is absolutely derogatory, it came out of the Vietnam War as a Western slur actually referring to small burlap bags containing Chinese war material for the Vietcong, then became a derogatory reference for Chinese Communism itself - and it is not okay on these Boards.

So, yeah. The removal was quite right as the moderation didn't wanna risk anything and deleted this stuff. Maybe OP didn't know anything about the meaning behind it and that is okay. But then it's the job of them to educate themself instead of blaming the moderation in this way.

> [{quoted}](name=Julevi,realm=EUW,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2019-12-13T12:56:58.044+0000)
>
> Dude, that's not a random applied ban. To be honest I am even quite surprised that they got only “a slap on the wrist“ for breaking the rules on a daily basis for so long. 
> 
> I don't wanna spread misinformation but as far as I remember they even had a removal of one thread/comment or even more because of racism (?)
> 
> Edit: I copypasted a part of one explanation OP already received in another thread.
> 
> So, yeah. The removal was quite right as the moderation didn't wanna risk anything and deleted this stuff. Maybe OP didn't know anything about the meaning behind it and that is okay. But then it's the job of them to educate themself instead of blaming the moderation in this way.

Apparently shitting on the users of a board  equals "not risking anything?" Are you serious? Did I miss something? Are we already at a point where not offending or exposing the chinese communist party and their influence is more important than they actual board users, players, customers.

Calling a Chinese person Chinese is racist now? Oh boy...

> [{quoted}](name=Salty Mc Feed,realm=EUW,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2019-12-13T13:14:02.540+0000)
>
> Calling a Chinese person Chinese is racist now? Oh boy...

It wasn't removed for being _racist_, though it does have a racist origin. It was removed for being _political_.

If someone said, "Democrats these days are so triggered", we would remove that too.

Hmmm the moderator apparently tells a different story maybe you should agree on a narrative before you start posting justifications, contradictions are about as bad as deleting peoples posts, unless your goal is to turn the boards into a deserted and dead place, then ok. 

The thing is... it's just really annoying to have wasted time posting something and then the whole thread suddenly disappears, or being interrupted in the middle of  conversation.

Tbh seems like the board kinda died already. Not much traffic. You probably have statistics too that can prove that.

> [{quoted}](name=Salty Mc Feed,realm=EUW,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=000400000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-12-13T15:22:20.597+0000)
>
> Hmmm the moderator apparently tells a different story maybe you should agree on a narrative before you start posting justifications, contradictions are about as bad as deleting peoples posts, unless your goal is to turn the boards into a deserted and dead place, then ok. 

Cali pointed out that it started as a racist term, but morphed into a derogatory one. I think Cali and I  are the only people on the team who know that history. 

Moreover,  a removal for racism looks different, as we respond much more forcefully to that. OP got 3 days for having a bunch of removals, the last of which was social/ political commentary. That it also includes a racial component only highlights how often people break more than one rule. 


> The thing is... it's just really annoying to have wasted time posting something and then the whole thread suddenly disappears, or being interrupted in the middle of  conversation.

We understand that frustration. it's also frustrating how many people don't realize how little they would have to change to prevent their content from being removed. It feels like being edgy on the internet is the most important thing to these people. 

> Tbh seems like the board kinda died already. Not much traffic. You probably have statistics too that can prove that.

Observation bias is a thing.

> It feels like being edgy on the internet is the most important thing to these people.

I don't think that's fair. Riot Games is affiliated with a political party that is running an authoritarian state. Riot Games also made it their goal to engage in social engineering... you know all that diversity, inclusivity and culture stuff, fight against toxicity etc so you can't just act like Riot Games exists in a vacuum and the boards users come up with "edgy discussions", because that's somehow their thing. It doesn't work like that.

If Riot Games decides to meddle in politics and social issues this is what you get, discussions about politics and social issues.
If people wanna talk about that because of Riot Games, you will always end up being the bad mod who has to censor them because of unfair rules.

> [{quoted}](name=Salty Mc Feed,realm=EUW,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=00040000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-12-13T17:11:07.296+0000)
>
> I don't think that's fair. Riot Games is affiliated with a political party that is running an authoritarian state. 

So is every single multi-national company. Depending on where you live, some people might think that also applies to local companies, as well.

>Riot Games also made it their goal to engage in social engineering... you know all that diversity, inclusivity and culture stuff, fight against toxicity etc so you can't just act like Riot Games exists in a vacuum and the boards users come up with "edgy discussions", because that's somehow their thing. It doesn't work like that.

What you call "social engineering", I call the base minimum requirements for a polite society.
 
> If Riot Games decides to meddle in politics and social issues this is what you get, discussions about politics and social issues.
> If people wanna talk about that because of Riot Games, you will always end up being the bad mod who has to censor them because of unfair rules.

_**As long as posters try to turn the Boards into 4chan or the YouTube comments section, I will always be needed to stop them.**_

FTFY

> [{quoted}](name=Ulanopo,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=000400000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-12-13T18:16:23.362+0000)

> 
> What you call "social engineering", I call the base minimum requirements for a polite society.

Authoritarians always justify their control in their head. I wonder what Hitler called all the Nazi rules (Nazi is short for German National Socialist, I hope that isn't "racial hatred" according to mods today).

All corporations have to follow the degenerate globalist agenda by default though, Riot is no different so I don't necessarily blame them. Though it is annoying to see the masses viewing it as "requirements for a polite society". The world is gonna be a messed up place in 50-100 years given how fast this social engineering has been pushed.

> [{quoted}](name=Kanyoupipu,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=0004000000000000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2019-12-13T22:34:07.759+0000)
>
> Authoritarians always justify their control in their head. I wonder what Hitler called all the Nazi rules (Nazi is short for German National Socialist, I hope that isn't "racial hatred" according to mods today).

As a practicing Ashkenazi Jew, it always pleases me when someone compares common decency with the Third Reich. It very clearly demonstrates who and what they are as a person.

Regardless, it might interest you to know that I am, _by far_, the most liberal person on the moderation team. I believe firmly in free speech, but I understand that free speech is not an unmitigated right, especially when speech is used to insult, harass or drive out others. I perceive my mandate as a moderator to be helping grow the Boards community into a welcoming and inclusive space. That means enforcing a minimum base level of respect.

If that feels too authoritarian for you, I would suggest you consider why that is, what part of your personality makes it necessary to be hurtful to others, especially when it takes so little effort to be better. If you figure it out, maybe you can explain it to me, as I've never understood the need myself.

> but I understand that free speech is not an unmitigated right, especially when speech is used to insult, harass or drive out others.

Then you don't understand free speech. Not a surprise given your first sentence.

Believing in free speech simply means I won’t attempt to censor you purely because I disagree with you. That’s not what happened here. You have free speech - none of the moderators are compelling you to say anything at all. They are saying that **should you choose** to speak in “their house”, you must follow their rules.

“Free speech” sounds great on paper. It sounds horrible when you claim “censorship”. But there is a time and a place for everything. Imagine if I stood outside your bedroom door loudly screaming a rant about how  was a . You’d kick me out of your house, right?

Being a supporter of free speech does not mean being a supporter of **unlimited** speech. In fact, I guarantee you that there is a situation that could arise in which you would not be a proponent of unlimited speech as you claim to be. Maybe it’s me screaming outside your bedroom. Maybe it’s deliberately false information. Maybe you draw the line when someone else intentionally and knowingly reals horrible lies about you.

Point is, you cannot expect anyone to believe you support speech without limits - because that is saying you support anarchy where there is no rules.

> [{quoted}](name=Kanyoupipu,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=000400000000000000000000000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2019-12-14T21:05:39.099+0000)
>
> Then you don't understand free speech. Not a surprise given your first sentence.

Free speech simply means that the US government can't make laws limiting speech, but it doesn't mean freedom of speech consequences, nor does it apply to privately owned businesses such as Riot Games. For example, you can't incite a riot, yell "Fire!" in a crowded theater or plan to kill the president and not be held accountable for it.
I hope you even understood my last posts...I am not sure.

> [{quoted}](name=Salty Mc Feed,realm=EUW,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-12-13T12:52:08.920+0000)
>
> Kindess and respect...
> Such as deleting peoples content and banning them for 3 days because you THINK that something MIGHT be offensive to SOME people.
> So kind... so respectful... wow....

I know right. Gotta love the backpedaling on the original point, but the smug, condescending arrogant "holier than thou" attitude never goes away with these types. Its just boring once you know their source code.

Frankly, why should the mods care what you think? You seem to stand for the permission to act like an asshole without accountability just because you're unwilling to remain civil in a discussion.

I don't see a reason that mods (or Riot) should give a shit about that opinion. Discussions are more constructive when both sides don't devolve into insults being thrown around.

I have changed "racial slur" to "derogatory political term" in the message that offended you so, Kanyoupipu.  Is that better?

Please let's be honest here - it's not a nice word.  I wince every time I see it, because it is one of those terms that just has an ugly, racially tinged history and derogatory overtones no matter where it seems to show up.  It has never been a nice word, not since it was invented by Western forces in the Vietnam War to refer to war supplies provided to the North Vietnamese by China, and the Chinese providers of the same.  I have never *once* seen "chicom" used in a non-derogatory sense.    

But we can call it a derogatory political term instead of an outright racial slur if you like.  

It's not okay on the Boards either way, and your removal was a justified one.

> [{quoted}](name=CaliCoastReplay,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2019-12-13T17:19:16.133+0000)
>
> I have changed "racial slur" to "derogatory political term" in the message that offended you so, Kanyoupipu.  Is that better?
> 
> Please let's be honest here - it's not a nice word.  I wince every time I see it, because it is one of those terms that just has an ugly, racially tinged history and derogatory overtones no matter where it seems to show up.  It has never been a nice word, not since it was invented by Western forces in the Vietnam War to refer to war supplies provided to the North Vietnamese by China, and the Chinese providers of the same.  I have never *once* seen "chicom" used in a non-derogatory sense.    
> 
> But we can call it a derogatory political term instead of an outright racial slur if you like.  
> 
> It's not okay on the Boards either way, and your removal was a justified one.

Now I am the "offended one"? Thats rich coming from the "not nice words" guy.

I only care that I get censored and banned. I don't care what you say, the overly-politically-correct corporate lawyer-type mod posting is boring af, its nothing new.
Please feel free to post a screenshot of the message the moderation gave you + your full original comment.
I can't because they banned me and removed the comment....

> [{quoted}](name=Kanyoupipu,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=kpqAs7ve,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-12-13T07:33:48.141+0000)
>
> You are welcome to disagree, **the problem is other people aren't because they will get censored because I am right**.

"Would all absent students please raise your hand? Thank you. Since we're all here today..."

Idk... I was just a middle of a conversation and the thread got straight deleted... no idea why. 
At the very least they could have locked it and left a comment with their reasons.
If you remove stuff without a trace people will assume it's power abuse, rightfully so.
Yea no idea why anyone would care to downvote this comment. If I disagree with something I will reply and give reasons instead of pushing a useless button.
I like OP.

**Let me emphasize: My disrespect for anyone posting here is so high that I wear downvotes like a badge of honor. If you upvoted me I would be actually worried and concerned. (given the state of the boards)**
